FuncDef:
The packet-priority command sets an 802.1p priority for Y.1731 and 802.1ag packets in an MA.
The undo packet-priority command restores the default 802.1p priority.
By default, the 802.1p priority is 7 for Y.1731 and 802.1ag packets in an MA.

ParaDef.Info:
Sets an 802.1p priority for Y.1731 and 802.1ag packets.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 7. A larger value indicates a higher priority. The default value is 7.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Packets with different 802.1p priorities are transmitted with different priorities. To change the priority of transmitting Y.1731 and 802.1ag packets, run the packet-priority command to set an 802.1p priority for the Y.1731 and 802.1ag packets.
Prerequisites
An MD and an MA have been configured using the cfm md and ma commands, respectively.
